question: where is the north pole on the world map
vanilla_rag_result: The North Pole is located at the northernmost point on Earth, defined by geodetic latitude 90° North. It is situated in the Northern Hemisphere where Earth's axis of rotation meets its surface, specifically in the middle of the Arctic Ocean, amidst waters that are almost permanently covered with shifting sea ice. On a world map, it is at the top center, directly opposite the South Pole, which is located in Antarctica.
